titles.title: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 9) denouncing the horrors of socialism, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 76) removing a certain Member from a certain standing committee of the House.

Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 9) denouncing the horrors of socialism, and providing for consideration of the resolution (H. Res. 76) removing a certain Member from a certain standing committee of the House.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 118-2, by Mr. Reschenthaler.
All points of order against consideration and provisions are waived and are considered as read. Rule also provides for one hour of general debate on each resolution.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 2.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 83.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 83, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 83 and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 207 (Roll no. 101).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 218 - 209 (Roll no. 102).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of
H. Con. Res. 9 (denounces socialism and opposes the implementation of socialist policies in the United States), and H. Res. 76 (removes Representative Ilhan Omar of Minnesota from the House Committee on Foreign Affairs).
